text:
This particular austerity lasts for four days.
 On the first day a devotee should observe 'Ekabhakta vrata'(having food only once a day in the noon).
 On the second day he should observe 'Nakta' vrata(having food only once a day in the night).
 On the third day he should break his fast by having whatever is available with him because anything that has been provided by others is strictly prohibited.
 He should observe a total fast on the fourth day.
 When a devotee observes these cycles of austerity for three times then it is called 'Prajapatya krichchhra vrata'.
title: Paad Krichchha Vrata
